class.name: RopeAppearance
class.brief_description: A resource for describing the appearance of a Rope.
class.description: This resource contains properties that control how a Rope is rendered. It also allows for the attachment of nodes at points along the rope.

members.member: Diameter of the rope. The rope caps will be scaled by this value as well.
Number of sides to render the rope with. Minimum is 3. If less than 3 the rope sides will be based on the rope_width.
The rate at which the V parameter of the UV texture space repeats along the rope.

The number of subdivisions to divide the segments by. A catmull spline will be used to interpolate along the rope, increasing curvature. Switch to wireframe view to see impact of this setting on polygon count.
Number of particles per meter of rope. The smallest number of particles you can have is 2.
The material to use when rendering the rope. If null, the default material will be used.
NodePath to a node to attach tp the start of the rope. The node will be aligned to the rope's start frame.
Offset along the rope to attach the start node to. In meters.
NodePath to a node to attach to the end of the rope. The node will be aligned to the rope's end frame.
Offset along the rope to attach the end node to. In meters.
